TopicTitle: Guess who's not going back to Kerbin

Articles.Content:
My mission did not go as expected... I blame the kerbals.

*UPDATE* Rover landing mission unsuccessful too many times... I would like a helping hand with rover landings.. Suggestions anyone?

Edited May 6, 2013 by AxelNova

Och! Bummer. Congratulations on building a capable design.

There is still hope. It might be possible to right the ship. Drain all the RCS fuel from the top tanks to the big one below. Retract and extend landing gear while rolling around. Either you'll be back on your feet, or more things will explode. If you do manage to get upright, right-click on the opposite engine and shut it down, leaving the other two activated.

Or, just press F9. You did quicksave before the descent, right?
Reminds me of my first manned Mun landing.
My first Mun landing was similar.

Well a rescue mission is on it's way because I can't get the lander to work. And if I could there would not be enough fuel to get back to Kerbin anyway. You should've seen the landing it took me like 20 minutes and it was hilarious and stresfull at the same time. I'm also sending a tiny rover to Mun as well for some in depth exploration. The rover is ready to go but I have trouble getting it to space. I don't know where's the issue because the rover is veeeeery tiny so it should not be a problem but for some reason it still is. Anyone give me a hand?

Good luck with the rescue! You'll learn a lot when designing rescue rockets.

With a little practice, that ship should land fine, assuming you have enough fuel.

That's a lot of RCS you've got there.

Sure you need that much on a landing stage?
Turned out to come in handy while landing. For a n00b in KSP like me there's never enough RCS but I think I learned from my mistakes and the rover will land safely and then the rescue rocket.
That's what I originaly thought but... Then I started it up but my tries ended up in another devastating crash...
